Has it been partitioned already?
If you run gparted it should help you partition then format it
You can't format a disk that hasn't been partitioned yet. Gparted will let you do both in one shot
The point of unplugging it then replugging it is to then look at the output of command: dmesg|tail  to discover what device it is. This is important so as not to format the wrong device.
The command will have some line with something like:    /dev/sdd                or such
Yes. I just told you that the reason to unplug and replug the usb pendrive is to determine then  which devicename it is receiving so that the correct device gets partitioned and then formatted
OK. So now you need to know about pastebin website, so that you can post the result of command:  dmesg|tail                    to there
After this we will know the devicename which is correct to partition then format
Hopefully you did not accidentally say "yes" to the command you tried earlier when it told you sdb1 was mounted
